alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 11:01AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.8 feet, Flood stage at the powerhouse gage location in lamoille canyon. Minor flooding can occur in the town of lamoille. Water can seep into basements near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:55 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 4.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM PDT Thursday was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 4.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.1 feet on 06/03/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow after 1000 AM PDT.
